description.plain:
Melissa Jefferson (born April 27, 1988), better known by her stage name Lizzo, is a Modern-Hip Hop & R&B singer. She is a founding member of indie hip hop groups The Chalice, GRRRL PRTY, The Clerb, Ellypseas, and Absynthe.

She first came to the spotlight when she released her song “Batches & Cookies” in 2013. The single then lead to a release of her first album Lizzobangers in 2014. Since 2014 she has been recognized and supported by artists such as Cupcakke, Charli XCX, Parson James, and, Dorian Electra.

In 2016 Lizzo released Coconut Oil – EP along with her single “Scuse Me.” Coconut Oil’s most popular single “Good As Hell” was released on May 11th 2016 as apart of the film The Barbershop: The Next Cut.

In late 2017 she released two singles “Water Me” and “Truth Hurts” in September of 2017 as singles to a possible upcoming project/album.

On April 19th, 2019, Lizzo released her second album Cuz I Love You. The album managed to have major success due to the re-release of earlier singles “Truth Hurts”, “Good As Hell” and “Water Me”. “Truth Hurts” being the most popular single managed to be her highest and first charting single peaking at #1 on the Billboard Hot 100 Charts.

songs.full_title: Truth Hurts by Lizzo
songs.title: Truth Hurts

description.plain:
On Lizzo’s breakthrough single, she flaunts her confidence after breaking up with an unfaithful lover. Despite coming out in 2017, “Truth Hurts” gained traction after being included in the 2019 Netflix film Someone Great, and reached #1 on the Billboard Hot 100 in September 2019.

Lizzo told People that she considered quitting music after the song came out, but her family and collaborators encouraged her to continue with her career, allowing her to reap the benefits and watch the song become a hit.

Lizzo’s hit song and video “Juice” continues her streak of feel-good singles about loving and being yourself. The song was released as the lead single for her third album Cuz I Love You.

As she explains in an interview with The New York Times:

I think “juice” is kinda freaky, I think “juice” is kind of spiritual and special. I think it’s black pussy.

songs.full_title: Good as Hell by Lizzo
songs.title: Good as Hell

description.plain:
This is a single by indie rap artist Lizzo, included on the Barbershop: The Next Cut soundtrack. The song is an ode to self-love, produced by Ricky Reed, who is behind a ton of 2016’s pop confections (Twenty One Pilots, Meghan Trainor, and more).

Lizzo described the process of making the song with Idolator:

It came from Ricky Reed and I. We have such a great chemistry in the studio and I think we had maybe made one or two songs prior. We were still doing chemistry tests with each other. We were in the studio and he was playing this piano riff and he was like, “How does this make you feel?”. I went through a lot of things in my head but it made me feel was like the hair toss emoji. You know, the pink sweater emoji girl with the hair. So I went from that hair toss, to checking my nails. It was a natural statement that came out my mouth. Ricky was like “feeling good as hell”. We just rolled with that. After that everything just kind of came out so easily. That’s when I think our chemistry was really sealed. I just felt like everything’s going to be okay.

songs.full_title: Rumors by Lizzo (Ft. Cardi B)
songs.title: Rumors

description.plain:
“Rumors” is Lizzo’s first release of 2021, and her first major release since her critically acclaimed 2019 album Cuz I Love You. Fellow rapper Cardi B features on the track, marking the first collaboration between the two. “Rumors” likely acts as the debut single to Lizzo’s follow-up album.

The song was teased with an a capella snippet on August 1, 2021, through Lizzo’s TikTok account, with a second one following on August 6. On August 9, she revealed Cardi B as the feature through a FaceTime call posted on her socials. The two held a livestream on YouTube ahead of the music video’s release alongside the single on the night of August 12th.

songs.full_title: About Damn Time by Lizzo
songs.title: About Damn Time

description.plain:
“About Damn Time” is Lizzo’s first release in 2022, and the lead single for her senior studio album, Special. This song comes after her short hiatus from her previous collaborative single, “Rumors”, with rapper Cardi B. As the track’s title already suggests, Lizzo reveals her excitement and relief over releasing her long-awaited studio album through this Disco-Pop track.

The song was first revealed and teased on The Late Late Show with James Corden, which featured a snippet of the pre-chorus and chorus on March 22, 2022, and the following day Lizzo teased the first lines through a TikTok video.

songs.full_title: Boys by Lizzo
songs.title: Boys

description.plain:
“Boys” was released as a single in June 2018 and later, in May 2019, as a bonus track on Cuz I Love You (Deluxe). To promote the single, four remixes were also commissioned.

Throughout the song, Lizzo states that she ‘doesn’t discriminate’ when it comes to men in her dating pool.
When asked about the meaning of the song, Lizzo commented:

From this black girl to the world, I want you to identify with my story no matter what you like in yo’ holes. I want people to feel free, I want people to have fun, I want these boys to know that you could be my next victim… if you play your cards right.”

The song was accompanied with a music video the same day of its release.
In the music video, Lizzo dances in front of the iconic music note wall where Prince commemorated in 1977.

songs.full_title: Grrrls by Lizzo
songs.title: Grrrls

description.plain:
“Grrrls” is a promotional single for Lizzo’s fourth studio album, Special. It’s an empowering anthem about women sharing their love and power with each other with a beat that samples “Girls” by Beastie Boys. It has a similar upbeat, empowering feel as her smash hit “Truth Hurts”.

Two days before the track was released, Lizzo teased the track through her TikTok account.

songs.full_title: Tempo by Lizzo (Ft. Missy Elliott)
songs.title: Tempo

description.plain:
“Tempo” is the third single of Lizzo’s album Cuz I Love You, released on April 19, 2019. Featuring the iconic rapper Missy Elliott, the song is about body acceptance and how Lizzo needs a heavy beat to dance since slow songs are not enough for all she has to offer.

In an interview with Exclaim!, Lizzo spoke about her collaboration with Missy Elliott on “Tempo”:

I’m very fortunate to be in a position where I have access to send Missy [Elliott] beats, and I have the privilege of being like, ‘Yo, let’s get Missy on this track.’ I was really hopeful that she would hop and she did, and now it’s become this moment for me. You know, when the song was first going down, it was more like ‘Finally I can talk my shit about being a big girl,’ but when Missy jumped on it, it really did make it a full-circle moment of being seen by her existing when I was younger. Hopefully I can really do the same for young girls today. But really, I was just making bops.

songs.title: Soulmate

description.plain:
Soulmate is the fourth song from Lizzo’s 3rd studio album, Cuz I Love You.

The song talks about the loneliness that can be present, even if you’re not technically single. Lizzo made this song because she needed “a song to remind me that I’m not lonely and to describe the type of person I want to be.”

songs.full_title: Jerome by Lizzo
songs.title: Jerome

description.plain:
Addressing more intimate singles like “Jerome” and “Lingerie”, Lizzo told Exclaim!:

Big women are pursued for relationships, big women deal with fuckboys, big women are beautiful and loving creatures, and it’s just not talked about, because it’s not the story that mainstream media chooses to tell. I’m not creating a fantasy — if it’s shocking, it’s because that story isn’t told and that’s often because big women aren’t even involved to tell their [own] stories. I just happen to be here in the room, I have a platform and I’m telling the story. I’m not going to shy away from it, I’m not embarrassed, this is who I am."

songs.full_title: Special by Lizzo
songs.title: Special

description.plain:
“Special” is the title track of Lizzo’s forth studio album. She performed the track live for the first time on April 16th on SNL, along “About Damn Time.”

It was teased for the first time by Lizzo on January 26, 2022, on a TikTok she posted on her account. The next day, the song was used for Logitech’s new campaign, where Lizzo appears as a guest.

I’ve always wanted to make my momma proud. Today was her first time hearing my new music. She told me she has ALWAYS been proud of me. (Even in my crazy rock star sleeping in my car days). She always made me feel special. In case nobody told you yet… you’re special. Keep going. I’m proud of you.


Lizzo via her TikTok.



On April 16, Lizzo also discussed how special this song was to her with radio DJ Zane Lowe and mentioned the song was originally titled “In Case Nobody Told You.”

songs.full_title: Scuse Me by Lizzo
songs.title: Scuse Me

description.plain:
“Scuse Me” is a song by Lizzo, released as the third single from her debut extended play, entitled Coconut Oil.

Lyrically, the song discusses personal flaws in life and by not being happy inside. The song reflects on the fact that no matter what anybody thinks, it’s important that you are happy and respect yourself.

songs.full_title: 2 Be Loved (Am I Ready) by Lizzo
songs.title: 2 Be Loved (Am I Ready)

description.plain:
“2 Be Loved (Am I Ready)” is a heavily influenced synth-pop track that debuts as Lizzo’s fourth track on her sophomore album, Special. As the title track already explains itself, Lizzo asks the question, “Is she ready to be loved?” which could be a post-continuation of her 2017 smashing hit, “Truth Hurts”

Lizzo used the track to reveal the tracklist and vinyl format in a TikTok, Instagram Post, Twitter Post, and on Facebook on July 6.

songs.full_title: Coconut Oil by Lizzo
songs.title: Coconut Oil

description.plain:
The title track from Lizzo’s EP celebrating self-love and self-sufficiency.

From Pitchfork:

The perception of coconut oil as a cure for all of life’s problems has achieved legendary, and therefore meme-able, status… As an integral part of many skin and Afro haircare rituals, it has come to represent something very important for black women in particular, who rally around its power to heal from the outside in.

So no, it’s not all about masturbation.

songs.full_title: Phone by Lizzo
songs.title: Phone

description.plain:
“Phone” is the second single from Lizzo’s debut extended play, entitled ‘'Coconut Oil’‘. The song was released 19 September 2016.

It discusses about how the world is slowly being consumed by its surroundings, specifically technology, and forgetting it’s real purpose. For instance, Lizzo sings about phones and how many people use it for social media, gaming, and many other uses. However, what people fail to realize is a phone’s real purpose, which is to call somebody, and that people can get so wound up in what else technology can do besides that.

In a 2019 Zachary Campbell interview Lizzo says this song was written in 10 minutes. Lizzo also says she was looking for her phone and was ask people “Where the f*ck my phone.” E. Bogart is one of the writers on this song wrote Halo and produced for Sia. Some heard her saying that, and they asked if it was a song and Lizzo said no it’s just something we say. So they immediately stopped the song they were working on, and the producer was told to play a little drum beat, and she starts singing the same line over and over “Where the hell my phone.” Lizzo says that it was Evan Bogart who was kind of her hypeman shouting out ideas of things for her to talk about, this song is mostly freestyled.

description.plain:
Addressing more intimate singles like “Jerome” and “Lingerie”, Lizzo told Exclaim!:

Big women are pursued for relationships, big women deal with fuckboys, big women are beautiful and loving creatures, and it’s just not talked about, because it’s not the story that mainstream media chooses to tell. I’m not creating a fantasy — if it’s shocking, it’s because that story isn’t told and that’s often because big women aren’t even involved to tell their [own] stories. I just happen to be here in the room, I have a platform and I’m telling the story. I’m not going to shy away from it, I’m not embarrassed, this is who I am.”

songs.full_title: Worship by Lizzo
songs.title: Worship

description.plain:
Worship was the first ever song written with Ricky Reed in LA.
In an April 2019 interview with Zachary Campbell, Lizzo stated she was not a singer before this song. She went on to say she would rap but sing on her hooks.  Ricky asked her if she could sing and she said a little. He then tested her by playing a few notes to test how high she could sing.
She said the experience was different and she didn’t feel like herself. She didn’t think she could sing that high, but she did, referring to the chorus when she sings “hands to the sky.”

description.plain:
Lizzo takes us on a night out and encourages us to remove our masks off and show our true selves on a funky Disco-Pop track.

It’s no surprise the song is titled “Everybody’s Gay,” Lizzo has been an inspirational role model since her debut, using her voice to uplift others such as the queer community and herself.

In an interview for Audacy’s CHANNEL Q back in April 2022, she teased the track by saying the following:

I would be so excited to do Pride this year for a few reasons. I can’t talk about it right now, but when the music comes out, I think people are going to be very happy.

songs.full_title: I Love You Bitch by Lizzo
songs.title: I Love You Bitch

description.plain:
As the fifth track on R&B singer Lizzo’s fourth studio album Special, “I Love You Bitch” is a song about having that person with you always, and being really grateful for having them. “I Love You Bitch” samples “I Hate U Bitch”, and takes the opposite meaning to that track.

The track was teased in a TikTok posted by Lizzo on July 7. In the TikTok Lizzo shows a Tweet from Cardi B, where Cardi says

I want a love song from Lizzo next

Lizzo said in the caption

Say Less😏😏😏

songs.full_title: Fitness by Lizzo
songs.title: Fitness

description.plain:
“Fitness” is the 3rd single off of Lizzo’s upcoming project.

In a recent interview with ConsequencesOfSound she states what the song is about and how it relates to her:

It’s a celebration of movement, highlighting the power in all body types. The women in this video are my team and closest collaborators including the brilliant director Quinn Wilson. I hope to inspire women all over to put themselves first. And next time someone has a critique about you or your body, say “I don’t do this for you."

songs.full_title: If You Love Me by Lizzo
songs.title: If You Love Me

description.plain:
On February 13, 2022, an ad break for the Super Bowl featured Lizzo for the Google Pixel 6. Lizzo agreed to the partnership as the Google Pixel 6 has new technology called “Real Tone” that focuses on capturing everybody’s real skin color, specifically for people of color. In the background of this ad, you can hear Lizzo’s unreleased song, “If You Love Me” playing. This ad seems to be a preview of the song, which Lizzo probably plans on releasing soon.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XhUgcYw9cj4

songs.full_title: Coldplay by Lizzo
songs.title: Coldplay

description.plain:
As one of the most personal and vulnerable tracks she has done, “Coldplay” serves as the closing track to Lizzo’s Special. It contains a portion of “Yellow” by Coldplay, since the name, and also samples “SUDDEN DEATH” by Quelle Chris & Chris Keys.

Lizzo opens her heart up and dedicates this song to her significant other, which she spent the whole album figuring out if she’s ready for it or not.

songs.full_title: Break Up Twice by Lizzo
songs.title: Break Up Twice

description.plain: “Break Up Twice” is Lizzo’s seventh track on her sophomore album, Special, which takes heavy inspiration from a mixture of R&B and Rock elements. In the song’s significance, Lizzo lays down an ultimatum between her and her future partner, revealing how she wants things in a relationship to run as she’s not a fan of breaking up twice.

songs.lyrics:
TranslationsLizzo - A Very Special Message From Lizzo (తెలుగు అనువాదాలు)EspañolA Very Special Message From Lizzo Lyrics[Spoken]
So here we are
You're finally able to listen to this album I've been workin' on for three years
And I know it's been a long time and it's about damn time I put it out
But you have to know that I took my time for me
But I also took my time for you
I wrote almost a hundred and seventy songs for this album
To find these perfect twelve songs to bring to you because
I felt like this was what not only I needed to hear
But you needed to hear and the whole world needs to hear
These are songs about love
Whether it's sеlf-love, love for your family, love for your friеnds
Or love for a significant other
I really believe that love for ones self and for others is what this world needs to be a better place
If you can take just the time to give a little love to yourself every single day
Treat yourself with respect
Treat yourself the way you deserve to be treated
And then treat somebody else with that same love and respect?
That expands, that grows
And that can save a life
It saved my life so many times
And I'm so honored to be a part of your life
I hope you enjoy the music
I hope you cry, laugh, dance, twerk
Do the splits, do whatever you wanna do
I'm honored to be doing it with you
So thank you for listening to Special, loving Special, and being special
'Cause if you don't take nothin' away from this album, I want you to know
You're special and I'm so glad you're still with us
Thank youSee Lizzo LiveGet tickets as low as $36Embed
